00074 /* Global variables ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00075 __ALIGN4 USBDCore_TypeDef gUSBCore;
00076 USBD_Driver_TypeDef gUSBDriver;
00077 u32 gIsLowPowerAllowed = TRUE;
00078 
00079 __ALIGN4 u32 TxBuf[2][HALF_BUF_SIZE];
00080 __ALIGN4 u32 I2SBuf[I2S_BUF_SIZE][HALF_BUF_SIZE];
00081 u8 I2SBufWriteIndex = 0;
00082 u8 I2SBufReadIndex = 0;
00083 vu8 I2SBufLen = 0;
00084 vu8 AltBuf = 1;
00085 
00086 I2CM_TransferType I2CM_Transfer;
00087 
00088 const u16 I2S_RateControlCounterTable[1] =
00089 {
00090   2000, // 0.05%
00091   //1000, // 0.10%
00092   //665,  // 0.15%
00093 };
00094 int I2S_RateContronIndex = 0;
00095 int I2S_CurrentRateContronIndex = 0;
00096 u8 I2SPreLen = 0;
00097 vu32 gI2S_RateProcessDownCnt;

00100 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00101   * @brief  Main program.
00102   * @retval None
00103   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00104 int main(void)
00105 {
00106   RETARGET_Configuration();           /* Retarget Related configuration                                     */
00107 
00108   NVIC_Configuration();
00109   CKCU_Configuration();
00110   GPIO_Configuration();
00111 
00112   USB_Configuration();                /* USB Related configuration                                          */
00113 
00114   I2CM_Init();
00115   WM8978_Init();
00116 
00117   /* Config PDMA for I2S TX                                                                                 */
00118   PDMA_Configuration();
00119 
00120   /* Config I2S                                                                                             */
00121   I2S_Configuration();
00122 
00123   SYSTICK_Configuration();
00124 
00125   HT32F_DVB_USBConnect();
00126 
00127   while (1)
00128   {
00129     USBDCore_MainRoutine(&gUSBCore);  /* USB core main routine                                              */
00130     I2S_MainRoutine();
00131   }
00132 }

00134 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00135  * @brief  I2S Main Routine.
00136  * @retval None
00137  ************************************************************************************************************/
00138 void I2S_MainRoutine(void)
00139 {
00140   if (UAC_bMuteControl == 0x00)
00141   {
00142     I2S_TxMuteCmd(DISABLE);
00143   }
00144   else
00145   {
00146     I2S_TxMuteCmd(ENABLE);
00147   }
00148 
00149   if (gI2S_RateProcessDownCnt == 0)
00150   {
00151     gI2S_RateProcessDownCnt = 5;
00152 
00153     if (I2SBufLen < I2S_BUF_MID)
00154     {
00155       if (I2SPreLen >= I2SBufLen)
00156       {
00157         I2S_RateContronIndex += 1;
00158         if (I2S_RateContronIndex > 1)
00159         {
00160           I2S_RateContronIndex = 1;
00161         }
00162       }
00163     }
00164     else if (I2SBufLen > I2S_BUF_MID)
00165     {
00166       if (I2SPreLen <= I2SBufLen)
00167       {
00168         I2S_RateContronIndex -= 1;
00169         if (I2S_RateContronIndex < -1)
00170         {
00171           I2S_RateContronIndex = -1;
00172         }
00173       }
00174     }
00175     else
00176     {
00177       I2S_RateContronIndex = 0;
00178     }
00179 
00180     if (I2S_CurrentRateContronIndex != I2S_RateContronIndex)
00181     {
00182       I2S_CurrentRateContronIndex = I2S_RateContronIndex;
00183 
00184       if (I2S_CurrentRateContronIndex > 0)
00185       {
00186         HT_I2S->CR |= I2S_RCSEL;
00187         HT_I2S->RCNTR = I2S_RateControlCounterTable[I2S_CurrentRateContronIndex - 1];
00188       }
00189       else if (I2S_CurrentRateContronIndex < 0)
00190       {
00191         int tmp = 0 - I2S_CurrentRateContronIndex;
00192         HT_I2S->CR &= ~I2S_RCSEL;
00193         HT_I2S->RCNTR = I2S_RateControlCounterTable[tmp - 1];
00194       }
00195       else
00196       {
00197         HT_I2S->RCNTR = 0;
00198       }
00199     }
00200 
00201     #if 0
00202     {
00203       static int a;
00204       static u8 b, c, cc;
00205       cc =I2SBufLen;
00206       if ((a != I2S_CurrentRateContronIndex) || (b != I2SPreLen) || (c != cc))
00207         printf("\r\n%d %u %u", I2S_CurrentRateContronIndex, I2SPreLen, I2SBufLen);
00208 
00209       a = I2S_CurrentRateContronIndex;
00210       b = I2SPreLen;
00211       c = cc;
00212     }
00213     #endif
00214 
00215     I2SPreLen = I2SBufLen;
00216   }
00217 }
00218 
00219 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00220   * @brief  Suspend call back function which enter DeepSleep1
00221   * @param  uPara: Parameter for Call back function
00222   * @retval None
00223   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00224 void Suspend(u32 uPara)
00225 {
00226   #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00227   u32 IsRemoteWakeupAllowed;
00228   #endif
00229 
00230   if (gIsLowPowerAllowed)
00231   {
00232 
00233     #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00234     /* Disable EXTI interrupt to prevent interrupt occurred after wakeup                                    */
00235     EXTI_IntConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, DISABLE);
00236     IsRemoteWakeupAllowed = USBDCore_GetRemoteWakeUpFeature(&gUSBCore);
00237 
00238     if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE)
00239     {
00240       /* Enable EXTI wake event and clear wakeup flag                                                       */
00241       EXTI_WakeupEventConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, EXTI_WAKEUP_LOW_LEVEL, ENABLE);
00242       EXTI_ClearWakeupFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00243     }
00244     #endif
00245 
00246     __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld >DEEPSLEEP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00247 
00248     // Add your procedure here which disable related IO to reduce power consumption
00249     // ..................
00250     //
00251 
00252     if ((gUSBCore.Info.CurrentStatus == USB_STATE_SUSPENDED) && ((HT_USB->CSR & 0xC0) == 0x40))   // D+ = 1, D- = 0
00253     {
00254       /* For Bus powered device, you must enter DeepSleep1 when device has been suspended. For self-powered */
00255       /* device, you may decide to enter DeepSleep1 or not depended on your application.                    */
00256 
00257       /* For the convenient during debugging and evaluation stage, the USBDCore_LowPower() is map to a null */
00258       /* function by default. In the real product, you must map this function to the low power function of  */
00259       /* firmware library by setting USBDCORE_ENABLE_LOW_POWER as 1 (in the ht32fxxxx_usbdconf.h file).     */
00260       USBDCore_LowPower();
00261     }
00262 
00263     // Add your procedure here which recovery related IO for application
00264     // ..................
00265     //
00266 
00267     __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld <DEEPSLEEP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00268 
00269     #if (REMOTE_WAKEUP == 1)
00270     if (EXTI_GetWakeupFlagStatus(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL) == SET)
00271     {
00272       __DBG_USBPrintf("%06ld WAKEUP\r\n", ++__DBG_USBCount);
00273       if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE && USBDCore_IsSuspend(&gUSBCore) == TRUE)
00274       {
00275         USBDCore_TriggerRemoteWakeup();
00276       }
00277     }
00278 
00279     if (IsRemoteWakeupAllowed == TRUE)
00280     {
00281       /* Disable EXTI wake event and clear wakeup flag                                                      */
00282       EXTI_WakeupEventConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, EXTI_WAKEUP_LOW_LEVEL, DISABLE);
00283       EXTI_ClearWakeupFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00284     }
00285 
00286     /* Clear EXTI edge flag and enable EXTI interrupt                                                       */
00287     EXTI_ClearEdgeFlag(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL);
00288     EXTI_IntConfig(KEY1_BUTTON_EXTI_CHANNEL, ENABLE);
00289     #endif
00290   }
00291 
00292   return;
00293 }

00295 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00296   * @brief  Get I2S Buffer Full state
00297   * @retval TRUE or FALSE
00298   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00299 bool I2S_IsBufferFull(void)
00300 {
00301   if (I2SBufLen >= I2S_BUF_SIZE)
00302     return TRUE;
00303   else
00304     return FALSE;
00305 }
00306 
00307 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00308  * @brief  Get I2S Buffer Empty State
00309  * @retval TRUE or FALSE
00310  ************************************************************************************************************/
00311 bool I2S_IsBufferEmpty(void)
00312 {
00313   if (I2SBufLen == 0)
00314     return TRUE;
00315   else
00316     return FALSE;
00317 }
00318 
00319 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00320  * @brief  Write Data into I2S software buffer
00321  * @retval 0 or I2S_BUF_SIZE
00322  ************************************************************************************************************/
00323 u32 I2S_BufferWrite(u32* pFrom)
00324 {
00325   if (I2SBufLen > I2S_BUF_SIZE)
00326   {
00327     return 0;
00328   }
00329   else
00330   {
00331     u32* pTo = (u32*)&I2SBuf[I2SBufWriteIndex][0];
00332     int i = HALF_BUF_SIZE;
00333 
00334     __set_PRIMASK(1);
00335 
00336     while (i--)
00337     {
00338       *pTo = *pFrom;
00339       pTo++;
00340       pFrom++;
00341     }
00342     I2SBufWriteIndex++;
00343     if (I2SBufWriteIndex == I2S_BUF_SIZE)
00344     {
00345       I2SBufWriteIndex = 0;
00346     }
00347     I2SBufLen++;
00348 
00349     __set_PRIMASK(0);
00350 
00351     return I2S_BUF_SIZE;
00352   }
00353 }
00354 
00355 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00356  * @brief  Read I2C Software buffer
00357  * @retval Always 0
00358  ************************************************************************************************************/
00359 u32 I2S_BufferRead(u32* pTo)
00360 {
00361   if (I2SBufLen == 0)
00362   {
00363     int i = HALF_BUF_SIZE;
00364 
00365     while (i--)
00366     {
00367       *pTo = 0x00000000;
00368       pTo++;
00369     }
00370 
00371     return 0;
00372   }
00373   else
00374   {
00375     u32* pFrom = (u32*)&I2SBuf[I2SBufReadIndex][0];
00376     int i = HALF_BUF_SIZE;
00377 
00378     __set_PRIMASK(1);
00379 
00380     while (i--)
00381     {
00382       *pTo = *pFrom;
00383       pTo++;
00384       pFrom++;
00385     }
00386     I2SBufReadIndex++;
00387     if (I2SBufReadIndex == I2S_BUF_SIZE)
00388     {
00389       I2SBufReadIndex = 0;
00390     }
00391     I2SBufLen--;
00392 
00393     __set_PRIMASK(0);
00394 
00395     return I2S_BUF_SIZE;
00396   }
00397 }

00403 void CKCU_Configuration(void)
00404 {
00405 #if 1
00406   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00407   CKCUClock.Bit.PDMA          = 1;
00408   CKCUClock.Bit.USBD          = 1;
00409   CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO          = 1;
00410   CKCUClock.Bit.EXTI          = 1;
00411   CKCUClock.Bit.I2S           = 1;
00412   HTCFG_I2CM_CKCU(CKCUClock)  = 1;
00413   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00414 #endif
00415 }

00417 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00418   * @brief  Configure USART.
00419   * @retval None
00420   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00421 void GPIO_Configuration(void)
00422 {
00423   /* I2S                                                                                                    */
00424   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2S_BCLK_ID, HTCFG_I2S_BCLK_ADIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_I2S);
00425   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2S_SDO_ID,  HTCFG_I2S_SDO_ADIO_PIN,  AFIO_FUN_I2S);
00426   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2S_SDI_ID,  HTCFG_I2S_SDI_ADIO_PIN,  AFIO_FUN_I2S);
00427   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2S_MCLK_ID, HTCFG_I2S_MCLK_ADIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_I2S);
00428   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2S_WS_ID,   HTCFG_I2S_WS_ADIO_PIN,   AFIO_FUN_I2S);
00429 
00430   /* I2C                                                                                                    */
00431   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2CM_MASTER_SCK_ID, HTCFG_I2CM_MASTER_SCK_AFIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_I2C);
00432   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_I2CM_MASTER_SDA_ID, HTCFG_I2CM_MASTER_SDA_AFIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_I2C);
00433 }

00435 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00436   * @brief  SYSTICK_Configuration.
00437   * @retval None
00438   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00439 void SYSTICK_Configuration(void)
00440 {
00441   /* SYSTICK configuration                                                                                  */
00442   SYSTICK_ClockSourceConfig(SYSTICK_SRC_FCLK);
00443   SYSTICK_SetReloadValue((HTCFG_SYSTICK_1US_MUL * 1000) - 1);
00444   SYSTICK_IntConfig(DISABLE);
00445 
00446   /* Enable the SysTick Counter                                                                             */
00447   SYSTICK_CounterCmd(SYSTICK_COUNTER_ENABLE);
00448 
00449   /* Enable Timebase Interrupt                                                                              */
00450   SYSTICK_IntConfig(ENABLE);
00451 }

00453 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00454   * @brief  Configure the NVIC vector table.
00455   * @retval None
00456   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00457 void NVIC_Configuration(void)
00458 {
00459   NVIC_SetVectorTable(NVIC_VECTTABLE_FLASH, 0x0);     /* Set the Vector Table base location at 0x00000000   */
00460 
00461   NVIC_SetPriority(PDMACH2_5_IRQn, 0);
00462   NVIC_SetPriority(HTCFG_I2CM_IRQ, 2);
00463   NVIC_SetPriority(USB_IRQn, 2);
00464   NVIC_SetPriority(I2S_IRQn, 3);
00465 
00466   NVIC_EnableIRQ(I2S_IRQn);
00467   NVIC_EnableIRQ(PDMACH2_5_IRQn);
00468   NVIC_EnableIRQ(HTCFG_I2CM_IRQ);
00469 }
00470 
00471 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00472   * @brief  Configure USB.
00473   * @retval None
00474   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00475 void USB_Configuration(void)
00476 {
00477   #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00478   USBPLL_Configuration();
00479   #endif
00480 
00481   #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_VREG)
00482   USBVRG_Configuration();                               /* Voltage of USB setting                           */
00483   #endif
00484 
00485   gUSBCore.pDriver = (u32 *)&gUSBDriver;                /* Initiate memory pointer of USB driver            */
00486   gUSBCore.Power.CallBack_Suspend.func  = Suspend;      /* Install suspend call back function into USB core */
00487   //gUSBCore.Power.CallBack_Suspend.uPara = (u32)NULL;
00488 
00489   USBDDesc_Init(&gUSBCore.Device.Desc);                 /* Initiate memory pointer of descriptor            */
00490   USBDClass_Init(&gUSBCore.Class);                      /* Initiate USB Class layer                         */
00491   USBDCore_Init(&gUSBCore);                             /* Initiate USB Core layer                          */
00492 
00493   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00494      Must turn on if the USB clock source is from HSI (PLL clock Source)
00495   */
00496   #if 0
00497   { /* Turn on HSI auto trim function                                                                       */
00498     CKCU_HSIAutoTrimClkConfig(CKCU_ATC_USB);
00499     CKCU_HSIAutoTrimCmd(ENABLE);
00500   }
00501   #endif
00502 
00503   NVIC_EnableIRQ(USB_IRQn);                             /* Enable USB device interrupt                      */
00504 }
00505 
00506 #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL)
00507 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00508  * @brief  Configure USB PLL
00509  * @retval None
00510  ************************************************************************************************************/
00511 void USBPLL_Configuration(void)
00512 {
00513   { /* USB PLL configuration                                                                                */
00514 
00515     /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00516        Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00517        Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00518     */
00519     CKCU_PLLInitTypeDef PLLInit;
00520 
00521     PLLInit.ClockSource = CKCU_PLLSRC_HSE;  // CKCU_PLLSRC_HSE or CKCU_PLLSRC_HSI
00522     #if (LIBCFG_CKCU_USB_PLL_96M)
00523     PLLInit.CFG = CKCU_USBPLL_8M_96M;
00524     #else
00525     PLLInit.CFG = CKCU_USBPLL_8M_48M;
00526     #endif
00527     PLLInit.BYPASSCmd = DISABLE;
00528     CKCU_USBPLLInit(&PLLInit);
00529   }
00530 
00531   CKCU_USBPLLCmd(ENABLE);
00532 
00533   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_USBPLLRDY) == RESET);
00534   CKCU_USBClockConfig(CKCU_CKUSBPLL);
00535 }
00536 #endif
00537 
00538 #if (LIBCFG_PWRCU_VREG)
00539 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00540  * @brief  Configure USB Voltage
00541  * @retval None
00542  ************************************************************************************************************/
00543 void USBVRG_Configuration(void)
00544 {
00545   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00546   CKCUClock.Bit.BKP                   = 1;
00547   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00548 
00549   PWRCU_SetVREG(PWRCU_VREG_3V3);
00550 
00551   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00552      USB LDO should be enabled (PWRCU_VREG_ENABLE) if the MCU VDD > 3.6 V.
00553   */
00554   PWRCU_VREGConfig(PWRCU_VREG_BYPASS);
00555 }
00556 #endif

00558 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00559   * @brief  Configure the I2S.
00560   * @retval None
00561   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00562 void I2S_Configuration(void)
00563 {
00564   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00565      Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00566      Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00567   */
00568   I2S_InitTypeDef I2S_InitStructure;
00569   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_Mode = I2S_MASTER_TX_RX;
00570   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_Format = I2S_JUSTIFIED_STEREO;
00571   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_WordWidth = I2S_WORDWIDTH_16;
00572   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_MclkOut = ENABLE;
00573   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_MclkInv = DISABLE;
00574   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_BclkInv = DISABLE;
00575   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_X_Div = HTCFG_I2S_X_DIV;                // MCLK = (PCLK * X_DIV / Y_DIV) / 2 = about 12.288 MHz (256 x 48 kHz, WM8978 required the MCLK = 256 fs)
00576   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_Y_Div = HTCFG_I2S_Y_DIV;
00577   I2S_InitStructure.I2S_N_Div = 256 / (2 * 16) - 1;             // BCLK = MCLK / 8 = about 1536 kHz (32 x 48 kHz, 2 CH x 16-bit = 32 fs)
00578   I2S_Init(&I2S_InitStructure);
00579 
00580   I2S_FIFOTrigLevelConfig(I2S_TX_FIFO, 4);  // Tx FIFO data '<' or '=' 3
00581   I2S_PDMACmd(I2S_PDMAREQ_TX, ENABLE);
00582 
00583   I2S_IntConfig(I2S_INT_TXFIFO_UDF, ENABLE);
00584 
00585   I2S_Cmd(ENABLE);
00586 
00587   /* Enable I2S Rate Control                                                                                */
00588   HT_I2S->CR |= I2S_RCEN;
00589 }
00590 
00591 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00592   * @brief  Configure the PDMA.
00593   * @retval None
00594   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00595 void PDMA_Configuration(void)
00596 {
00597   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00598      Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00599      Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00600   */
00601   PDMACH_InitTypeDef PDMACH_InitStructure;
00602   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_SrcAddr = (u32)&TxBuf[0][0];
00603   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_DstAddr = (u32)&HT_I2S->TXDR;
00604   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_AdrMod = (SRC_ADR_LIN_INC | DST_ADR_FIX | AUTO_RELOAD);
00605   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_BlkCnt = BUF_SIZE / 4;
00606   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_BlkLen = 4;
00607   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_DataSize = WIDTH_32BIT;
00608   PDMACH_InitStructure.PDMACH_Priority = M_PRIO;
00609   PDMA_Config(PDMA_CH2, &PDMACH_InitStructure);
00610 
00611   PDMA_IntConfig(PDMA_CH2, (PDMA_INT_GE | PDMA_INT_TC | PDMA_INT_HT), ENABLE);
00612 
00613   PDMA_EnaCmd(PDMA_CH2, ENABLE);
00614 }
00615 
00616 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00617  * @brief   This function is used to init the I2C master.
00618  * @retval  None
00619  ************************************************************************************************************/
00620 void I2CM_Init(void)
00621 {
00622   /* !!! NOTICE !!!
00623      Notice that the local variable (structure) did not have an initial value.
00624      Please confirm that there are no missing members in the parameter settings below in this function.
00625   */
00626   I2C_InitTypeDef  I2C_InitStructure;
00627 
00628   /* I2C configuration                                                                                      */
00629   I2C_InitStructure.I2C_GeneralCall     = I2C_GENERALCALL_DISABLE;
00630   I2C_InitStructure.I2C_AddressingMode  = I2C_ADDRESSING_7BIT;
00631   I2C_InitStructure.I2C_Acknowledge     = I2C_ACK_DISABLE;
00632   I2C_InitStructure.I2C_OwnAddress      = I2CM_OWN_ADDR;
00633   I2C_InitStructure.I2C_Speed           = I2CM_SPEED;
00634   I2C_InitStructure.I2C_SpeedOffset     = 0;
00635   I2C_Init(I2CM, &I2C_InitStructure);
00636 
00637   I2C_SetTimeOutPrescaler(I2CM, I2C_PRESCALER_128);
00638   I2C_SetTimeOutValue(I2CM, ((SystemCoreClock/128) * 8 * 10) / I2CM_SPEED); /* Must within 10 Bytes Time    */
00639 
00640   /* Enable I2C                                                                                             */
00641   I2C_Cmd(I2CM, ENABLE);
00642   I2C_TimeOutCmd(I2CM, ENABLE);
00643 
00644   /* Enable I2C interrupts                                                                                  */
00645   I2C_IntConfig(I2CM, I2C_INT_STA | I2C_INT_ADRS | I2C_INT_RXDNE | I2C_INT_TXDE |\
00646                       I2C_INT_RXNACK | I2C_INT_TOUT | I2C_INT_BUSERR | I2C_INT_ARBLOS, ENABLE);
00647 }
00648 
00649 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00650  * @brief   Set the word address mode used 8 bits or 16 bits.
00651  * @param   word_addr_mode: Specify addressing mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
00652  *    @arg   I2CM_WORD_ADDR_MODE_1BYTE
00653  *    @arg   I2CM_WORD_ADDR_MODE_2BYTE
00654  * @retval  none
00655  ************************************************************************************************************/
00656 void I2CM_WordAddressModeConfig(u32 word_addr_mode)
00657 {
00658   I2CM_Transfer.RegAddrMode = word_addr_mode;
00659 }
00660 
00661 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00662  * @brief   Install the I2C master transfer end callback function.
00663  * @param   callback: Specify a pointer that point to callback function.
00664  * @retval  none
00665  ************************************************************************************************************/
00666 void I2CM_InstallTransferEndCallback(void (*callback)(void))
00667 {
00668   I2CM_Transfer.TransferEndCallback = callback;
00669 }
00670 
00671 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00672  * @brief   Uninstall the I2C master transfer end callback function
00673  * @retval  none
00674  ************************************************************************************************************/
00675 void I2CM_UninstallTransferEndCallback(void)
00676 {
00677   I2CM_Transfer.TransferEndCallback = NULL;
00678 }
00679 
00680 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00681  * @brief   Get the I2C master transfer status.
00682  * @retval  SUCCESS or ERROR
00683  ************************************************************************************************************/
00684 u32 I2CM_GetTransferStatus(void)
00685 {
00686   u32 return_value = I2CM_BUSY;
00687   I2CM_TransferType* pTransfer = &I2CM_Transfer;
00688 
00689   if (pTransfer->Status != I2CM_BUSY)
00690   {
00691     u32 timeout = 500; /* 50 mS                                                                             */
00692     while (I2C_GetFlagStatus(I2CM, I2C_FLAG_BUSBUSY))
00693     {
00694       I2CM_DelayXuS(100);
00695       timeout--;
00696       if (timeout == 0)
00697       {
00698         pTransfer->Status = I2CM_TOUTF;
00699         I2C_GenerateSTOP(I2CM);
00700         I2CM_DelayXuS(1000);
00701         I2C_DeInit(I2CM);
00702         break;
00703       }
00704     }
00705     return_value = pTransfer->Status;
00706   }
00707 
00708   return return_value;
00709 }
00710 
00711 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00712  * @brief   Waits until the transfer is completed.
00713  * @retval  SUCCESS or ERROR
00714  ************************************************************************************************************/
00715 ErrStatus I2CM_WaitTransferEnd(void)
00716 {
00717   ErrStatus retv = ERROR;
00718 
00719   while (1)
00720   {
00721     u32 status = I2CM_GetTransferStatus();
00722     if (status != I2CM_BUSY)
00723     {
00724       if (status == I2CM_OK)
00725       {
00726         retv = SUCCESS;
00727       }
00728       else
00729       {
00730         I2CM_DBG_PRINTF("\r\nI2CM Error state 0x%X at line %u\r\n", status, __LINE__);
00731       }
00732       break;
00733     }
00734   }
00735 
00736   return retv;
00737 }
00738 
00739 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00740  * @brief   Read data from I2C.
00741  * @param   dev: Specify the target I2C device address.
00742  * @param   word_addr: Specify the word address of target I2C device.
00743  * @param   data: Specify pointer that point to the receive buffer.
00744  * @param   count: Specify the read data length.
00745  * @retval  None
00746  ************************************************************************************************************/
00747 void I2CM_BufferRead(u16 dev, u16 word_addr, u8* data, u16 count)
00748 {
00749   I2CM_TransferType* pTransfer = &I2CM_Transfer;
00750 
00751   while (I2CM_GetTransferStatus() == I2CM_BUSY);
00752 
00753   pTransfer->RegAddr     = word_addr;
00754   pTransfer->Buffer      = data;
00755   pTransfer->Length      = count;
00756   pTransfer->Counter     = 0;
00757   pTransfer->Direction   = I2CM_DIRECTION_IN;
00758   pTransfer->DevAddr     = dev;
00759   pTransfer->Status      = I2CM_BUSY;
00760   pTransfer->RetryDownCounter = I2CM_BUS_MAX_RETRY;
00761 
00762   /* Send I2C START                                                                                         */
00763   I2C_TargetAddressConfig(I2CM, pTransfer->DevAddr, I2C_MASTER_WRITE);
00764 }
00765 
00766 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00767  * @brief   Blocked Read data from I2C.
00768  * @param   dev: Specify the target I2C device address.
00769  * @param   word_addr: Specify the word address of target I2C device.
00770  * @param   data: Specify pointer that point to the receiver buffer.
00771  * @param   count: Specify the read data length.
00772  * @retval  SUCCESS or ERROR
00773  ************************************************************************************************************/
00774 ErrStatus I2CM_BlockedBufferRead(u16 dev, u16 word_addr, u8* data, u16 count)
00775 {
00776   I2CM_BufferRead(dev, word_addr, data, count);
00777   return I2CM_WaitTransferEnd();
00778 }
00779 
00780 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00781  * @brief   Write data to I2C.
00782  * @param   dev: Specify the target I2C device address.
00783  * @param   word_addr: Specify the word address of target I2C device.
00784  * @param   data: Specify pointer that point to the transmitter buffer.
00785  * @param   count: Specify the write data length.
00786  * @retval  None
00787  ************************************************************************************************************/
00788 void I2CM_BufferWrite(u16 dev, u16 word_addr, u8* data, u16 count)
00789 {
00790   I2CM_TransferType* pTransfer = &I2CM_Transfer;
00791 
00792   while (I2CM_GetTransferStatus() == I2CM_BUSY);
00793 
00794   pTransfer->RegAddr     = word_addr;
00795   pTransfer->Buffer      = data;
00796   pTransfer->Length      = count;
00797   pTransfer->Counter     = 0;
00798   pTransfer->Direction   = I2CM_DIRECTION_OUT;
00799   pTransfer->DevAddr     = dev;
00800   pTransfer->Status      = I2CM_BUSY;
00801   pTransfer->RetryDownCounter = I2CM_BUS_MAX_RETRY;
00802 
00803   /* Send I2C START                                                                                         */
00804   I2C_TargetAddressConfig(I2CM, pTransfer->DevAddr, I2C_MASTER_WRITE);
00805 
00806 }
00807 
00808 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00809  * @brief   Blocked write data to I2C.
00810  * @param   dev: Specify the target I2C device address.
00811  * @param   word_addr: Specify the word address of target I2C device.
00812  * @param   data: Specify pointer that point to the transmitter buffer.
00813  * @param   count: Specify the write data length.
00814  * @retval  SUCCESS or ERROR
00815  ************************************************************************************************************/
00816 ErrStatus I2CM_BlockedBufferWrite(u16 dev, u16 word_addr, u8* data, u16 count)
00817 {
00818   I2CM_BufferWrite(dev, word_addr, data, count);
00819   return I2CM_WaitTransferEnd();
00820 }
00821 
00822 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00823  * @brief  WM8978 register read
00824  * @retval None
00825  ************************************************************************************************************/
00826 void WM8978_RegWrite(u16 Address, u16 Data)
00827 {
00828   Address = (Address | Data) >> 8;
00829   I2CM_BlockedBufferWrite(WM8978_ID, Address, (u8*)&Data, 1);
00830 }
00831 
00832 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00833  * @brief  Init WM8978.
00834  * @retval None
00835  ************************************************************************************************************/
00836 void WM8978_Init(void)
00837 {
00838   /********************************************
00839    * Power On Sequence
00840    ********************************************/
00841   /* REG_00                                                                                                 */
00842   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_SOFTWARE_RESET, 0);
00843   /* REG_34 (Headphone)                                                                                     */
00844   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LOUT1_VOL, LOUT1MUTE);
00845   /* REG_35 (Headphone)                                                                                     */
00846   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ROUT1_VOL, ROUT1MUTE);
00847   /* REG_36 (SPK)                                                                                           */
00848   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LOUT2_VOL, LOUT2MUTE);
00849   /* REG_37 (SPK)                                                                                           */
00850   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ROUT2_VOL, ROUT2MUTE);
00851   /* REG_38                                                                                                 */
00852   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_OUT3_MIXER, OUT3MUTE);
00853   /* REG_39                                                                                                 */
00854   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_OUT4_MIXER, OUT4MUTE);
00855   /* REG_01                                                                                                 */
00856   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_POWER_MANAGEMENT1, BUFDCOPEN | BUFIOEN | VMIDSEL_75K | BIASEN | MICBEN);
00857   /* REG_31                                                                                                 */
00858   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_OUTPUT, SPKBOOST);
00859   /* REG_03                                                                                                 */
00860   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_POWER_MANAGEMENT3, LMIXEN | DACENL | RMIXEN | DACENR | LOUT2EN | ROUT2EN);
00861   /* REG_02                                                                                                 */
00862   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_POWER_MANAGEMENT2, LOUT1EN | ROUT1EN | INPPGAENL | INPPGAENR | ADCENL | ADCENR);
00863 
00864   /********************************************
00865    * Digital Audio Interfaces
00866    ********************************************/
00867   /* REG_04                                                                                                 */
00868   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_AUDIO_INTERFACE, /*FMT_I2S FMT_RIGHT_JUSTIFIED*/ FMT_I2S | WL_16BITS);
00869   /* REG_06                                                                                                 */
00870   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_CLOCK_GEN, CLKSEL_MCLK | MCLK_DIV1);
00871 
00872   /********************************************
00873    * Analogue Sample Rates & Analogue Outputs
00874    ********************************************/
00875   /* REG_07                                                                                                 */
00876 #if (SOURCE_TYPE_SEL == SOURCE_TYPE_VOICE)
00877   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ADDITIONAL, SR_8KHZ);
00878 #else
00879   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ADDITIONAL, SR_48KHZ);
00880 #endif
00881   /********************************************
00882    * GPIO
00883    ********************************************/
00884   /* REG_08                                                                                                 */
00885   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_GPIO, 0);
00886 
00887   /********************************************
00888    * Output Switching
00889    ********************************************/
00890   /* REG_09                                                                                                 */
00891   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_JACK_DETECT1, 0);
00892 
00893   /********************************************
00894    * Output Signal Path & Power Management
00895    ********************************************/
00896   /* REG_0A                                                                                                 */
00897   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_DAC, 0);
00898 
00899   /********************************************
00900    * Analogue to Digital Converter
00901    ********************************************/
00902   /* REG_0B                                                                                                 */
00903   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LEFT_DAC_VOL, DACVU | 0xFF);  /* 0xFF = 0dB, 0xFE = -0.5dB, 0xFD = -1dB, ...          */
00904 
00905   /********************************************
00906    * Output Signal Path
00907    ********************************************/
00908   /* REG_0C                                                                                                 */
00909   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_RIGHT_DAC_VOL, DACVU | 0xFF); /* 0xFF = 0dB, 0xFE = -0.5dB, 0xFD = -1dB, ...          */
00910 
00911   /********************************************
00912    * Output Switching
00913    ********************************************/
00914   /* REG_0D                                                                                                 */
00915   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_JACK_DETECT2, 0);
00916 
00917   /********************************************
00918    * Analogue to Digital Converter
00919    ********************************************/
00920   /* REG_0E                                                                                                 */
00921   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ADC, HPFEN | HPFAPP | HPFCUT_0 | ADCOSR128);
00922   /* REG_0F                                                                                                 */
00923   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LEFT_ADC_VOL, ADCVU | 0xFF);  /* 0xFF = 0dB, 0xFE = -0.5dB, 0xFD = -1dB, ...          */
00924   /* REG_10                                                                                                 */
00925   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_RIGHT_ADC_VOL, ADCVU | 0xFF); /* 0xFF = 0dB, 0xFE = -0.5dB, 0xFD = -1dB, ...          */
00926 
00927   /********************************************
00928    * Output Signal Path
00929    ********************************************/
00930   /* REG_12                                                                                                 */
00931   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_EQ1, EQ3DMODE_DAC | EQ1C_80HZ | 0x0C);
00932   /* REG_13                                                                                                 */
00933   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_EQ2, EQ2BW_NARROW | EQ2C_230HZ | 0x0C);
00934   /* REG_14                                                                                                 */
00935   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_EQ3, EQ3BW_NARROW | EQ3C_650HZ | 0x0C);
00936   /* REG_15                                                                                                 */
00937   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_EQ4, EQ4BW_NARROW | EQ4C_1_8KHZ | 0x0C);
00938   /* REG_16                                                                                                 */
00939   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_EQ5, EQ5C_5_3KHZ | 0x0C);
00940   /* REG_18                                                                                                 */
00941   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_DAC_LIMITER1, LIMDCY_750US | LIMATK_94US);
00942   /* REG_19                                                                                                 */
00943   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_DAC_LIMITER2, LIMLVL_N1DB | LIMBOOST_0DB);
00944 
00945   /********************************************
00946    * Analogue to Digital Converter
00947    ********************************************/
00948   /* REG_1B                                                                                                 */
00949   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_NOTCH_FILTER1, 0);
00950   /* REG_1C                                                                                                 */
00951   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_NOTCH_FILTER2, 0);
00952   /* REG_1D                                                                                                 */
00953   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_NOTCH_FILTER3, 0);
00954   /* REG_1E                                                                                                 */
00955   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_NOTCH_FILTER4, 0);
00956 
00957   /********************************************
00958    * Input Limiter Automatic Level Control
00959    ********************************************/
00960   /* REG_20                                                                                                 */
00961   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ALC1, ALCSEL_BOTH_ON | ALCMAXGAIN_35_25DB | ALCMINGAIN_N12DB);
00962   /* REG_21                                                                                                 */
00963   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ALC2, ALCHLD_0MS | ALCLVL_N12DBFS);
00964   /* REG_22                                                                                                 */
00965 #if (SOURCE_TYPE_SEL == SOURCE_TYPE_VOICE)
00966   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ALC3, ALCMODE_ALC | ALCDCY_3 | ALCATK_2);   // 8 kHz
00967 #else
00968   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ALC3, ALCMODE_ALC | ALCDCY_10 | ALCATK_6);  // 44.1 kHz
00969 #endif
00970   /* REG_23                                                                                                 */
00971   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_NOISE_GATE, NGEN | NGTH_N75DB);
00972 
00973   /********************************************
00974    * Analogue Outputs
00975    ********************************************/
00976   /* REG_2B                                                                                                 */
00977   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_BEEP, INVROUT2);
00978 
00979   /********************************************
00980    * Input Signal Path
00981    ********************************************/
00982   /* REG_2C                                                                                                 */
00983   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_INPUT, MBVSEL_0_65AVDD | RIN2INPVGA | RIP2INPVGA | LIN2INPVGA | LIP2INPVGA);
00984   /* REG_2D                                                                                                 */
00985   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LEFT_PGA_GAIN, INPPGAUPDATE | 0x10);
00986   /* REG_2E                                                                                                 */
00987   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_RIGHT_PGA_GAIN, INPPGAUPDATE | 0x10);
00988   /* REG_2F                                                                                                 */
00989   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LEFT_ADC_BOOST, /* PGABOOSTL | */ L2_2BOOSTVOL_DISABLED | AUXL2BOOSTVOL_DISABLED);
00990   /* REG_30                                                                                                 */
00991   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_RIGHT_ADC_BOOST, /* PGABOOSTR | */ R2_2BOOSTVOL_DISABLED | AUXR2BOOSTVOL_DISABLED);
00992 
00993   /********************************************
00994    * Analogue Output
00995    ********************************************/
00996   /* REG_31                                                                                                 */
00997   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_OUTPUT, TSDEN | SPKBOOST);
00998   /* REG_32                                                                                                 */
00999   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LEFT_MIXER, /* BYPLMIXVOL_6DB | BYPL2LMIX */ DACL2LMIX);
01000   /* REG_33                                                                                                 */
01001   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_RIGHT_MIXER, /* BYPRMIXVOL_6DB | BYPR2RMIX */ DACR2RMIX);
01002   /* REG_34                                                                                                 */
01003   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LOUT1_VOL, HPVU | (0x39 + 0));    // +0 dB range from -57dB to +6dB
01004   /* REG_35                                                                                                 */
01005   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ROUT1_VOL, HPVU | (0x39 + 0));    // +0 dB range from -57dB to +6dB
01006   /* REG_36                                                                                                 */
01007   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_LOUT2_VOL, SPKVU | (0x39 + 0));    // +0 dB range from -57dB to +6dB
01008   /* REG_37                                                                                                 */
01009   WM8978_RegWrite(REG_ROUT2_VOL, SPKVU | (0x39 + 0));    // +0 dB range from -57dB to +6dB
01010   /* REG_38                                                                                                 */
01011   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_OUT3_MIXER, OUT3MUTE);
01012   /* REG_39                                                                                                 */
01013   //WM8978_RegWrite(REG_OUT4_MIXER, OUT4MUTE);
01014 }
01015 
01016 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01017   * @brief  DelayXuS.
01018   * @param  uS: Delay us
01019   * @retval None
01020   ***********************************************************************************************************/
01021 void DelayXuS(u32 uS)
01022 {
01023   uS *= 20;
01024   while (uS--);
01025 }

01027 #if (HT32_LIB_DEBUG == 1)
01028 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
01029   * @brief  Report both the error name of the source file and the source line number.
01030   * @param  filename: pointer to the source file name.
01031   * @param  uline: error line source number.
01032   * @retval None
01033   ***********************************************************************************************************/
01034 void assert_error(u8* filename, u32 uline)
01035 {
01036   /*
01037      This function is called by IP library that the invalid parameters has been passed to the library API.
01038      Debug message can be added here.
01039      Example: printf("Parameter Error: file %s on line %d\r\n", filename, uline);
01040   */
01041 
01042   while (1)
01043   {
01044   }
01045 }
01046 #endif
